item.title: OP
item.description:
What a fucking miserable day today’s been. Came home this evening to the Main breaker panel being down again. Called FAC. While we were figuring out the issue with the power, we heard OP was electrocuted while playing in his yard and didn’t make it. Such a freaking tragic loss. How do you even come to terms with shit like this?

Rest in peace, little one. I’ll remember your glowing eyes and sheepish grin as you won me in your empire. I’ll remember you delicately handling your food when you came over to our place for dinner that night when you folks moved in to our block. I’ll remember you sitting by the side of the embassy pool slowly contemplating if you wanted to get in or not. I’ll remember you and J introducing me to your bunnies and you running all over your yard behind them. I’ll remember you and S running with those capes pretending to be superstars. And I so, so wish I got to know you more while you were around…

Life is so fucking fickle. Hug your dear ones’ more than ever before. EVERY SINGLE DAY. ðŸ”—

item.title: 2025 Year end note
item.description:
JAN | FEB | MAR | APR | MAY | JUN | JUL | AUG | SEP | OCT | NOV | DEC

JAN

  • We fit in a quick trip to Houston. Getting there and back was quite eventful!
  • Hiked La Malinche with the ESC boys and had a good taste of frostbite.
  • Work took me to Matamoros. Would be my last TDY while with ESC Mexico city!
  • M’s offer got rescinded because of the ‘Hiring freeze’…

FEB

  • Hiked Pico de Aguia sur yet again. Different route though.
  • Decided not to hike Orizaba. Could have checked this off the list had I planned this a bit better.
  • Bid adieu to the Mexico team!

MAR

  • ALL of this month was spent on our home-leave. NJ > Boston > Florida > Las Vegas > Utah/Arizona > Seattle > Vancouver > Baltimore
  • Highlight of this trip was visiting the slot canyons in Glen Canyon NRA. Oh and the skiing in Wachusett!

APR

  • Scheduled our consumables shipment for Yaounde.
  • PCS’d to Yaounde around mid April.
  • Six years ago, I walked out of WTW on April 1st. So glad I did!

MAY

  • Work trip to Malabo.
  • S still thinks it is a magical world!
  • Those Ceiba trees are magnificent!
  • Tourist for a day in Yaounde.

JUN

  • Took that armored cruiser for a spin.
  • Got tenured amidst news of RIFs…
  • Mummyjaan has that cardiac event and we get a taste of Cameroons abysmal medical system. Slowest four days of my recent past…

JUL

  • Our R&R turns into a Medevac to Dubai. Spent a few days with the Kulethas.
  • Fit in a whirlwind trip to Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, Trivandrum, Ernakulam, Bangalore and Madras.
  • S and I traveled together for a week. Our first without M!

AUG

  • Back to Malabo on another work trip.
  • Pushed the gas pedal on those IRAs.

SEP

  • Visited the Mefou primate sanctuary.
  • US begins it’s longest shutdown in history so far…

OCT

  • Furloughed for a day by mistake.
  • M&S visit london for a couple weeks and have a days’ layover on Istanbul.
  • This 92 year old head of state secures another seven year term.
  • Learnt something fun about watches.

NOV

  • Went to the 250th Marine ball.
  • Hiked up Mbankolo
  • M leaves for her LNA orientation.

DEC

  • Slowly falling into a rhythm solo-parenting S this month until her school break.
  • The Matha1’s made it to M’s flag-day!
  • S&I head to the U.S. for a couple weeks.
  • Skiing at Liberty. Just hit me that we did go skiing in Wachussett earlier this year in March!

And that’s a wrap! ðŸ”—

item.description: Those four words - ‘But it is mine’; Definitely makes it all worth it. I have a similar setup wherein I use a Hetzner VPS just to proxy in all traffic to my selfhosted stuff. Initially had wireguard running across my devices. Switched to tailscale for a bit more ease of management. Maybe every six months or so something breaks, but it is all manageable. item.title: Arzopa
item.description:
Tom’s post nudged me to revive my Digital photo frame that I set up last year. Turned it on this morning and it lit up like it was setup a minute ago. Love it! Took me a minute though to figure out how I’d initially set it up since I missed documenting it then. So here’s a quick note for posterity.

Hardware

  • Display: 15.6" Portable Display by Arzopa
  • Frame: A spare Ikea frame
  • SBC Board: A repurposed Raspberry Pi 3 from that snazzy Nextcloud Box
  • Thumb-drive for photos
  • Black Duct-tape!

Configuration

I leaned on the awesome DietPi OS for the base operating system. Once the system boots up a script runs FEH to display photos from the thumb-drive.

#! /bin/sh
cd /mnt/photos
feh -Z -z -F -D 60 --hide-pointer --auto-rotate --fullscreen

Essentially FEH picks up photos from the thumbdrive, random sorts them and displays a properly zoomed and oriented image every minute.

Display control

Run a cron job to turn the display on/off:

# crontab -e

# Turn on the screen at 06:00 AM
0 6 * * * DISPLAY=:0 xrandr --output HDMI-1 --auto

# Turn off the screen at 09:00 AM
0 9 * * * DISPLAY=:0 xrandr --output HDMI-1 --off

# Turn on the screen at 12:00 PM
0 12 * * * DISPLAY=:0 xrandr --output HDMI-1 --auto

# Turn off the screen at 03:00 PM
0 15 * * * DISPLAY=:0 xrandr --output HDMI-1 --off

# Turn on the screen at 05:00 PM
0 17 * * * DISPLAY=:0 xrandr --output HDMI-1 --auto

# Turn off the screen at 09:00 PM
0 21 * * * DISPLAY=:0 xrandr --output HDMI-1 --off

Choosing images

I currently manage my photo collection by syncing them into my Nextcloud server sorted by year, month and occasion. At the end of every month, I use Digikam to tag and export photos like-so:

  1. All photos are tagged by their month
  2. Then photos that I want to display on the screen are tagged as ‘Arzopa’.
  3. A saved search query exports these to the Thumbdrive.

Making this a manual process forces me to take a step back and actually choose what gets displayed on the screen besides giving me another opportunity to go back in time.

Next Steps

  • Setup scripts to turn off/on the screen based on the environment or time.
  • Enable touchscreen or button options to pause and navigate photos on demand. ðŸ”—

item.title: Insurance
item.description: My wife and I still haven’t figured where/when we want to retire yet, but sadly the U.S. seems to be a bleaker option with every passing day. I don’t think any country has really figured out their healthcare system well and those that had a decent stab at it seem to be hell bent on breaking it. For now, thankfully our Foreign service benefit plan does an okay job and we’re at an okay premium-benefit ratio. Only a question of time before that buckles though. As a former actuary, I do subscribe to the concept of having good insurance. However, the good ones are so few and stretched so thin. I keep telling my wife if we want to stay in the U.S. I should get back to teaching - Not just because I love it, but because it might also keep our premiums low in retirement. ðŸ”—

item.title: Mbankolo unlocked
item.description:
After a failed attempt last week, I made it up to Mbankolo this morning. Romero joined me and we ran into an LGF at the base of the hill. This place is pretty neat and way better than Mt. Febe! So glad I decided to give this another shot.

On the way back, instead of coming via the market, we decided to climb up towards Mt. Febe and took the inner roads via the golf course. This could be a fun route to retrace on the reverse sometime later.

I need to figure out why my garmin isn’t recording the GPX properly. Oddly, Looks like all other metrics are logged correctly. The only thing I really changed was syncing it with GadgetBridge last week.
